item.title: Battlefield 6 Season 1 - All New Maps And Vehicles
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Season 1 of Battlefield 6 adds three more multiplayer maps to the game. Two are brand-new, large-scale maps, and there is also a seasonal variant of an existing map. The new maps also introduce more vehicles to help you traverse the battlefield, which surprisingly includes a golf cart. In this guide, we'll highlight all the new maps and vehicles you'll find in Season 1 of Battlefield 6.

It's also important to know that these DLC maps and vehicles aren't all available at the launch of Season 1. The developer is rolling out Season 1 content in three separate phases. Season 1 starts with the Rogue Ops update, which is live now across all platforms. The California Resistance phase launches November 18, and the Winter Offensive arrives on December 9.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: 10 Minutes Of Battlefield 6 Season 1 New Maps Gameplay (Blackwell Fields and Eastwood)

A first look at all three maps can be found below. We also covered all of the new BF6 Season 1 weapons and attachments can be found here.

Rogue Ops - Blackwell Fields

Season 1 kicks off with the Rogue Ops update, which introduces the new Blackwell Fields map. This is a large-scale map set on a massive oil field in California, with lots of open ground for snipers and long-range combat. Structures like oil wells, construction equipment, and other items serve as cover on the map.

Blackwell Fields features the normal selection of vehicles, including helicopters, planes, and tanks. It also introduces the season's first new vehicle. The APC Traverser Mark 2 is a brand-new land vehicle. This armored vehicle seats four: one driver, one roof gunner, and two backseat passengers who operate as side gunners.

California Resistance - Eastwood

In the second phase coming in November, California Resistance takes the fight to the Cali suburbs with the Eastwood map. Pax Armata is attacking a Southern California town, and the fights take place in and around suburban homes, through backyards, and even across a golf course. The houses will give plenty of cover for close-quarters fights, but the golf course provides open ground for long-range engagements.

And speaking of golf, Eastwood introduces the golf cart as a new vehicle for the map. When the map launches in November, you'll be able to use golf carts to cruise around the map and create some interesting new shenanigans on the battlefield.

Winter Offensive - Ice Lock Empire State

The third and final phase of Season 1 is themed around the winter holiday. For this seasonal content, Battlefield 6 adds a winter-theme variant of the Empire State map. This is just a visual update that covers the New York map in ice and snow.

As of now, a new vehicle has not been announced for the Winter Offensive update.

For more, make sure to check out our Battlefield 6 guide hub. This includes recommendations for the best gadgets to use for each class, powerful weapon builds, and more.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: All New Battlefield 6 Weapons In Season 1 And How To Unlock Them
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Battlefield 6's first season features plenty of new weapons to unlock, but not all of them are available at launch. Season 1 is scheduled to roll out in three phases, so you'll have new weapons to unlock with each update. In this guide, we'll list all the Season 1 weapons and attachments, as well as explain how you can unlock each.

Battlefield 6 Season 1 starts with the Rogue Ops update, which is live now across all platforms. The California Resistance phase launches November 18, and the Winter Offensive arrives on December 9.

All of the Season 1 weapon details can be found below. The Rogue Ops weapons are available to unlock for free in the BF6 Season 1 battle pass, while the ones arriving in later updates will likely be unlocked through in-game events or challenges.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Rogue Ops weapons
    • Rogue Ops attachments
  • California Resistance weapons
    • California Resistance attachment
  • Winter Offensive weapon

Rogue Ops weapons

Rogue Ops adds the SOR-300SC carbine, the GGH-22 sidearm, the Mini Scout sniper rifle, and the Rail Cover and LPVO attachments.

The SOR-300SC carbine is described as a subcompact carbine with a low rate of fire, which wields high damage with .300 Blackout ammunition. This is unlocked for free at tier 21 of the Rogue Operators path.

For the Recon class, Season 1 adds the new Mini Scout sniper rifle. This is a light bolt-action sniper meant for faster sniping and better mobility. This is unlocked for free at tier 21 of the Soldiers of Fortune path.

Lastly, the GGH-22 sidearm is a new secondary weapon. The GGH-22 is a Glock 22 sidearm that is described as having low damage but faster firing. This is unlocked for free in the intro path of the Season 1 battle pass.

Rogue Ops attachments

Season 1 adds two new attachments to unlock. The Rail Covers attachment is available for some rifles and light machine guns, and this is designed to increase the gun's draw speed, while Low Powered Variable Optics (LPVO) scopes will give you a few more magnification options for light machine guns and rifles.

The LPVO attachment is unlocked through an in-game challenge found in the Season 1 challenge tab. Deal 3,000 damage beyond 75m and get 35 headshots to unlock it.

You'll need to unlock the LPVO attachment before gaining access to a new in-game challenge for the Rail Covers attachment.

California Resistance weapons

The November California Resistance phase will add the DB-12 shotgun and the M357 Trait sidearm. The Troy Angled attachment is the season's latest attachment.

The DB-12 is a dual-barrel pump-action shotgun that feeds from two different tubes. One trigger pull fires a shell (or slug) from one barrel, while a second trigger pull fires the other, then the pump action rechambers both barrels.

For a new secondary, the M357 Trait is a powerful new revolver. This is a high damage, eight-round revolver, which is balanced by a low rate of fire.

California Resistance attachment

California Resistance also has the third and final attachment for Season 1. The Slim Handstop is a new grip, and it is designed to offer an alternative choice for underbarrel attachments. It's described as providing a "unique blend of ergonomic and handling changes."

Winter Offensive weapon

As the name suggests, the Winter Offensive update is themed around holiday content and winter weather. This phase only has one weapon, which is the Ice Climbing Axe, but it perfectly fits the theme of the update and is paired with an icy variant of the Empire State map.

As of now, no new attachments have been announced for the Winter Offensive update.

For more, make sure to check out our Battlefield 6 guide hub. This includes recommendations for the best gadgets to use for each class, powerful weapon builds, and more.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
